page.title: 06The Parish Church part 3
page.content: On Tuesday May 14th. Class 4 of St. Andrew's School visited the Parish Church of St.Andrew, Much Hadham. We are hoping to gather information about the church and to draw and make brass rubbings, for our Domesday record. A few brasses still remain in the church and most of these are to the Newce Family, who lived in Henry V111's, Mary's and Elizabeth's time. Interestingly, one of these Newces seems to have embezzled church property, in the shape of a bell. The church building is of flint with stone dressing. The embattled western tower with pinnacles and spire, houses a peal of eight bells installed in 1950. (Six bells were recast and two new bells added as part of Much Hadham's war memorial).The peal was originally 5 bells,each bell inscribed with the donators name.
